ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Yet they play around in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet they are lost in doubt and play.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (But the fact is, they lack certainty) and frolic about in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In fact, the unbelievers have doubts because of excessive involvement in worldly affairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Rather they are in doubt, playing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay! They play about in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay, they are in doubt, they sport.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay, but they are in doubt, playing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but they play in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: yet, they toy with their doubts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But they play around in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Yet they play about in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet they are in doubt, playing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Yet they play around in doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:9] Nay, but they linger in doubt, concerning the Resurrection, playing, in mockery of you, O Muhammad (s), and so he said, ‘My God, assist me against them with seven [years of drought] like the seven of Joseph’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but they) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca (play in doubt) they poke fun at the coming of the Hour.
